intro: Austroeupatorium monardifolium, commonly known as New England aster, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy purple to pinkish-red composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and roadside ditches. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and branching. It plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
